content: Something really frustrating that happens almost every time, when I'm listening to Spotify on my PC my mobile phone automatically becomes a remote control, without me evem having Spotify open on it in the first place. The worst thing is when I want to raise the volume on my phone and instead of raising my phone volume I raise the Spotify volume ON THE PC. Please find a solution for this because this has really become infuriating.
Spotify is awesome app for listening music but 1 give 1 star for a reason. Spotify should make account deleting more user friendly ,it is very difficult to delete multiple accounts.

The app if very good and responsive, with crystal-clear audio. BUT there is one problem (only on phone), the 'We added' section make it so in a playlist its hard to actually find the songs in the playlist and you can't infinitely skip with no Spotify Premium. So when I play a playlist, I end up not being able to listen to the songs and it is really frustrating. Please Spotify devs and creators, PLEASE FIX THIS! This one problem has made me switch to Soundcloud, where there is NO problems. :(

It's a good app, but I do have a couple of problems with it. It works great and all, it's just that when you click on a playlist, you can't see every song that's in the playlist. I feel like that's the entire point. And you can't play songs in order. It's only shuffle play, nothing else. And if you search up a song, it shows the playlist for it instead of the song. For instance, if you searched "Lost Boy", it would give you "Lost Boy playlist" instead. It's good for basic use, though.

Exceptional service when i had trouble with the App, went beyond my expectations to help me out to resolve the issue. I have since discovered that Yamaha receivers do not play nicely with Spotify. It seems neither company has the will to remedy the situation. Despite the Yamaha being sold as being integrated with Spotify, it cannot play podcasts. Spotify apparently identifies them as multimedia files, and the Yamaha is configured to only play audio only files. Not the fault of the App. Fixed

They offer a wonderful way to enjoy the music you already want and love while also offering excellent new finds that usually match your interests as you rate various items. If you're more fidgety, like to hunt around for specific songs and play them immediately, the free version will hit you with s good deal more ads (6 in a row once🤬).

Reply: Hey, thanks for the report. If you haven't tried it yet, we'd suggest clearing the app's cache. Just head to Home > Settings (gear icon) > Storage > Delete cache. If that doesn't help, we’d recommend reaching out to Customer Service. Just head to support.spotify.com and search "contact us".

Pretty good. One incredibly annoying bug is that when you have files downloaded to listen offline... Finally Spotify has matured into a decent app worth paying for. A few issues remain: (1) no indicator on playlist screen to show if sequential play or shuffle play is active. Imho there should be two separate buttons, ie a standard play button and a shuffle button with suitable colour change when active. (2) should have an "AI" button to play more songs like this based on past listening history. (3) Need "hey Spotify" voice commands, especially when driving. Keep up the innovation 👍

Reply: Hey, sorry to hear that. If you haven't tried running a clean reinstall of the app and restarting your device yet, we'd suggest giving these a go. If the issue persists, you can get in touch with our Customer Service team so they can take a closer look. Just search “Contact us” at support.spotify.com, or send them a DM at twitter.com/SpotifyCares.

Spotify offers digital copyright restricted recorded music and podcasts, including more than 82 million songs, from record labels and media companies. As a freemium service, basic features are free with advertisements and limited control, while additional features, such as offline listening and commercial-free listening, are offered via paid subscriptions. Spotify is currently available in 180+ countries as of October 2021.

Spotify is a great way to listen to music although the recommendations are aren't always great. I often listen to music that I don't want influencing the recommendations since they don't always capture the feeling or specific sounds that I like. I wish there was a way to prevent those songs from being used in recommendations even without having to use private mode. It would also be nice if there was more control over the songs added to the Blend playlist besides listening and hoping songs get added to replace other songs I don't want in there. Spotify connect is and the in app notifications from connect is annoying since I always accidentally press connect to TV or google mini. More ways to edit and filter playlists would be nice like the ability to filter playlists based on loved tracks, time (like on desktop) and statistics like most/least played track and artist. Also, being able to mark each song by the mood/feeling that associate it with would be great for new song recommendations and filtering.

Pretty much the best music app available ( I'm talking about premium since I haven't used regular Spotify in a few years),the only issue I've had is the lyrics not showing up on my phone but the support team was really helpful and the issue will probably be resolved soon. It gets regular updates with a great user interface good music recommendations and great quality.
It's pretty good, although it does change music on you sometimes. For example, I'd be listening to a playlist of 8 Graves, and then it'd play TeZatalks out of nowhere. Other than that, it's fine.
Spotify is a music app that is fairly popular and has a very wide selection of songs, podcasts, and others without very many bugs
Works most of the time, but the iPhone app is so much more better
It was about to connect the music to the living rooms TV when I didn't even ask or idk how it got there.

Whilst no app is perfect. I've found so much music from all over the globe that I would have never have found if not for the clever features they use to match and recommend based on your tastes. The one thing I would like to see is instead of canvas, is individual track artwork on albums. The best thing about CDs were the booklets. Each track had a story. Also I think Spotify could do their own lyrics instead of out sourcing to Musixmatch. Spotify could do so much more to lead in their field.
the only thing i dont like is that i cant close the app and have music playing still. A habit of mine to clear out my apps.
Love it its nice and easy to use.
Wish I could chose what music I wanted to play and skip and go back to songs that I want without having to pay premium you know like the good ol days

Really good app to listen to music on, it has almost every song on there you can think of, the problem though is that I KEEP HAVING TO LISTEN TO SUGGESTED SONGS, and it is WAYYYY too annoying, I mean, CMON MAN! I DON'T WANNA LISTEN TO IT! and if I create a playlist and finish it, IT DOES NOT REPEAT, like DUDE.

It is one of my favourite app and i use it a lot but there are too many adds and also I am a big fan of kpop but when I hear the music the lyrics also come in Korean but not english so I can't understand it but i like the 30 mins break idea.

I think Spotify is great! However we should have the option mixes if we want the clean or explicit version. It's the same song we might as well be able to choose. Because sometimes I need to choose. I also feel we should be able to peek at the next song before we skip it. We only get 6 skips an hour I don't want to use them if I don't have to.
Pretty nice app to use to listen to music or podcasts. The option to share lyrics to snapchat has disappeared. Would like that to come back.

Hey, great app, been using it for many many years, using premium account and so far I was quite happy with the service. But recent bugs are really annoying, I cant check the song that is playing and today music started to stop playing for no reason dozens of times during day. Please! Fix it asap.

i really love this app, and I'm sort of relying on it to give me songs to listen to. but, since the most recent update, it keeps crashing and forcing closed. hopefully it will fix itself before the problem becomes irreversible!

It's fine, we have the family thing so we have a few accounts and it's all good.... BUT....I like Pink Floyd, and when I listen to their albums it's a bit annoying because there is a gap between each song even though I have it set as no gap in the settings. But otherwise it's great. Also,for some reason the control bar vanishes and you can't control the music. Also on few songs they don't have the original song or artist, eg The Sweet.. Love is Like Oxygen.
I like the way pandora puts their Playlists together better, but the overall use of the Spotify app is amazing. I love what you can do with it

Only thing I absolutely hate is when you hit random play, it plays the same songs. I feel like I never hear most of the songs I have on my Playlist. Then randomly hear one and I'm like oh I forgot this was on here. Fix random to not just play the same songs.......
I had a best experience with this app but as time goes it doesn't play my playlists anymore
The free trial is great and when thats over there are only a few adds that x o me between you are your music.😁😊👌🤌🤟👍
Sometime network issue otherwise amazing

I love this app but the new update is annoying. I know that's on purpose to make us buy premium. Giving us ads is enough. Not allowing us to choose or change the music and making shuffle disabled for us is annoying. I'll still give it a 4/5 cause I've been using this app for years already but I just haven't bought the premium.
Very good variety. Only complaint is repetition of some songs when there is a comprehensive playlist
This is a very good app, I can easily access the music I want
The music quality is excellent.

content: Great for listening to all kinds of music, but you do have to listen to a lot of ads and also cant pick songs on mobile. Thus i recommend SpotMute which mutes ads (not blocks) to stop having some soundcloud rapper in your ear every 4 minutes.
